Name: 7.92x57mm I.S.
Description: Damage: 106    Penetration: 26                                                                                                               7.92x57mm rifle cartridge, also known as 8x57mm rifle cartridge, initially designed by the German Military Commission in 1888, with the new 7.92x57mm spitzer bullet adopted by Germany after 1905. The I.S. Light Spitzer bullet is filled entirely with aluminum, with a silver-white shell. During World War II, the German military used this cartridge more frequently for training.
